content: slippery elm hat by sarah rody materials yarn about 180-210 yd 165-210 m of worsted weight yarn i used malabrigo rios this is a lighter worsted weight yarn 210 yd/200 m per 100 g if your yarn is heavier you might run out of yarn or have a larger hat if you are worried about running short of yarn you can opt for a single brim needles size us 6 4 mm needles or whatever size is needed to make gauge 16-inch 40 cm circulars and double-pointed needles or your preferred method of medium- and small- circumference knitting in the round size us 4 3 5 mm needles or 1-2 sizes smaller than your main needles 16-inch circulars for knitting the brim ribbing gauge 20 stitches and 27 row in 4 in x 4 in 10 cm x 10 cm of stockinette using the larger needles sizing this hat is snug on my 22-inch 56 cm head due to the stretch of the cables and ribbing stitch i think it would fit about 18-22 inches 46-56 cm to adjust the length you can easily add or subtract a full repeat 16 rnds or a half repeat 8 rnds if you change the length by a half repeat use the crown chart on the last page those instructions are charted only my finished hat is about 10 5 in 26 5 cm deep unfolded and 6 in 15 cm across laid flat pattern cast on 108 stitches using the smaller needles and either a tubular cast on or any other stretchy cast on join in the round and knit in 1x1 ribbing for 3 5 inches 9 cm approximately 25 rounds for a folded brim or 1 5 inches 3 8 cm for a non-folded brim 1x1 ribbing *k1 p1* repeat until the end of the round change to larger needles and begin on round 2 the increase round of the charts or written instructions round 1 references the last round of ribbing you will repeat the chart 3 times around change to small-circumference needles when necessary after the last round cut the yarn leaving an 8-inch 20 cm tail and thread it through the remaining 15 stitches twice weave in ends 1 written instructions last row of ribbing round 1 *k1 p1* repeat until the end of the round 108 st increases/set-up round 2 *k3 p2 m1pl p1 k2 m1l k3 p2 m1pl p1 k3 p1 k3 p2 m1pl p1 k2 m1l k3 p2 m1pl p1 k3 p1* repeat 126 st round 3 *c5fp p2 k6 p2 c5bp p1 k3 p4 k6 p4 k3 p1* repeat body round 4 + all even rnds through 42 knit in established pattern knit the knits and purl the purls round 5 *p2 c5fp c6b c5bp p3 k3 p4 k6 p4 k3 p1* repeat round 7 *p4 c6f c6f p5 k3 p4 c6b p4 k3 p1* repeat round 9
